column4: hi all, my intel e1000 network card do not work in my dapper, who can help me?
i can try,  what errors are you getting if any?
it works fine in fedora core, but i do not like fedora core,
I try pppoeconf and it cannot find eth0 or smth.

now i have only fc installed, so i can not show your my /etc/network/interface. I have 3 computers, for other two computers, I just install ubuntu, have my pppoeconf configured and try pon dsl-provider, and it works
but this machine, i failed to do so, because  it says i do not have eth0. so i think my driver is not right.
does your eth0 shows up in dmesg?
i run modprobe e100/e1000/eepro100, and i can see it in dmesg. but still no eth0
maybe it is not eth0, you have other nic cards? maybe it is ath0?
whatever it is , when i run pppoeconf, it should appear, however, when i try pppoeconf, it said "no ethernet card detected"
and i surf the web, many people have the same problem with SUSE,Fedora etc said that when upgrade to 2.6.19/20 kernel, they can use it
but in ubuntu, i cannot rebuild the kernel because I can not get the gcc or header file or something from the internet
umm what shows up in your /proc/sys/net/ipv4/conf  ?
I remove the dapper installtion. now I only have fc installed. I just want to ask how can I use a 2.6.19 kernel without link to the internet
If i have the 2.6.19 kernel, maybe my problem will be solved
